text: In Egyptian mythology, Babi, also Baba,Sir Ernest Alfred Wallis Budge, The gods of the Egyptians: or, Studies in Egyptian mythology, Vol II, Methuen & Co. 1904, p. 91-92. full view on Google BooksGeraldine Pinch, Handbook of Egyptian mythology, ABC-CLIO 2002, p. 112, , limited preview on Google Books was god in the form of a baboon. His name is translated as Bull of the baboons. This basically means boss of all baboons or the chief of the baboons.George Hart, The Routledge Dictionary of Egyptian Gods and Goddesses, Routledge 2005, p.44 Because Baboons have many human characteristics, it was believed that they were dead ancestors. Because baboons were thought to be the dead, Babi was felt to be an underworld deity. ==References== Category:Egyptian gods and goddesses
title: Babi
